author: chfast
content:
Hi <@!683653554631868440>

My explanation why we didn't include `RJUMPTABLE` in EIP-4200: https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/eip-4200-static-relative-jumps/7108/19
TL;DR Yes, this is common construction in many/all IRs but I have not found good use-case for it in solidity / EVM contracts. But I'm also not a contract dev so I'm more than happy to collect inputs from people who would use it for something interesting.

author: gcolvin
content: I don't consider it essential -- a string of conditional jumps will always do the job.  So it's more of an optimization, but I think worth having.  As we start restricting or deprecating JUMPI we will probably want it, especially for things like function pointers and virtual functions.

author: chfast
content: For "function pointers" and "virtual functions" you want `call_indirect` / `JUMPSUBV` / `CALLFV`.

author: gcolvin
content: RJUMPSUBV would be better, you are right.  You can do the call at each case for the RJUMPTABLE instead, but it's inefficient.  I'll consider adding RJUMPSUBV to EIP-2315.
